page.title: 05Roebuck / Badger Edge
page.content: be inhabited by people who work in the surrounding towns. {The Roebuck Inn}situated at the junction of five country lanes has been a meeting place for the local people for many years. Today it is as popular as ever with both local people and with the town dwellers of Oldham who drive out of town into the countryside for a pleasant evening of eating and drinking. {Badger Edge}is a hill rising to a height of over 1,200 feet (380 metres) and dominates the area. To the north there is a panoramic view over the Tame Valley towards Denshaw and the Pennines, with the valley side falling away steeply down to the river. The area has a bleak appearance with mainly rough grazing land, a few isolated dwellings and a marked absence of trees.
